1.title: Shit People Say to Nerd Girl
1.plot: People say a lot of weird stuff to nerd girls. I also know a bunch of girls who like the same stuff and we tend to talk about it. So I decided to put the stuff I've heard and what other girls tell me they've heard from people into a video for your entertainment.

6.title: More Female Main Characters in Games, Please!
6.plot: A video in which the host asks video game developers to include more female characters in their video games.

7.title: Video Game Concept: Professor Pennyfeather
7.plot: A video detailing a video game concept for a game called Professor Pennyfeather, in which the question is asked; what if Lara Croft was a real person? She would be really different! She'd be a middle aged, heavy set woman who spent most of her time in a classroom or a lab. She definitely couldn't run and jump and would be against guns. So I incorporated magic and companion animals to help her with the hard stuff.

9.title: Godzilla Review
9.plot: A review of the 2014 Godzilla movie

10.title: How I Play Video Games
10.plot: What happens when the hosts sits down to play a video game.

11.title: Edge of Tomorrow Review
11.plot: The host reviews the summer science fiction movie, Edge of Tomorrow.

12.title: Awkward Text Messaging
12.plot: A look at how text messaging can lead to some awkward situations.

13.title: I Read My Mean YouTube Comments
13.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

14.title: Holy Shit, I'm in Paris
14.plot: An episode chronicling the host's trip to Paris.

15.title: Follow Me at Indiecade 2014
15.plot: A day spent exploring the independent video game convention, Indiecade.

1.title: What the Hell Is Screen Looking?
1.plot: What is screen looking? Is it just part of the game, or is it cheating? Jayme and Christina play Mario Kart and have a heated discussion. The Geek's Guide to Going Outside explores some solutions.

2.title: Romance and Role-Playing Games
2.plot: A nerd girl explores how Final Fantasy 8 affected her view of romance forever. He plays a video game while she watches the waltz from Final Fantasy 8. The whole thing turns into a discussion about romance.

3.title: Why I Hate First Person Shooters
3.plot: Mashka tells us her opinion on first person shooters and why she doesn't like them as much as RPGs. She takes a shot and plays the popular FPS, Far Cry 3.

4.title: Online Dating: Guy's Perspective
4.plot: What are the pros and cons online dating for guys? Is it the ease of access? The vast number of choices? The fact that they don't need to leave the house? Probably the last one, at least for the guys of The Geeks Guide to Going Outside

5.title: Online Dating: Girl's Perspective
5.plot: What are the pros and cons online dating for girls? Is it the compatibility tests? The vast number of choices? The fun they have sharing the hilarious and strange messages they receive? Probably the last one, at least for the girls of The Geeks Guide to Going Outside.

6.title: Dramatic Reading of SimCity2013 Amazon Reviews
6.plot: We had the idea for this video back when absolutely no one could play the new SimCity game and everyone was very angry. All these reviews were under the 5 star section and there were many more that were really great. I tried looking for them again later and they were gone.

7.title: Cats: The Nerd's Best Friend
7.plot: Mashka really likes cats, but in true nerd fashion, she's allergic to them! Does that stop her from snuggling with them? Absolutely not. Larry is pretty cuddly, but he never pays the rent and gets high on catnip all the time.

8.title: Fake Nerd Boys
8.plot: Mashka knows she's not the only one who has been noticing this prevalence of fake nerd boys. Guys who just pretend to play video games and like Sci-Fi to get attention and be mean to other people.

9.title: Fun with the Xbox One
9.plot: The year is 2014, and there is a two party system: Xbox One and PS4. All movements are monitored by Google, in partnership with state officials. If you are speeding on the freeway, your GPS unit notifies police and an electronic ticket is emailed to you. If you called in sick at work, your boss can check your Facebook geolocation to see if you are at home (for a small fee). There is a database about you. it compiles info from all of the games you have ever played, all the emails you have ever sent, the photos you took, and every thing you bought with your credit card....

10.title: The Neverhood Retro Game Review
10.plot: A review of the Windows 98 claymation game, The Neverhood. The Neverhood was produced by Pencil Test Studios.

1.title: Judging Video Games by Their Cover (And Nothing Else)
1.plot: Sometimes video game box art is just odd, and doesn't really say anything about the game that it's representing, even though it's usually the first thing we see. So Mashka decided to take a couple of popular games and pretend that she didn't know what they where about to illustrate how silly and mystifying they can be, all in the name of a few laughs.

2.title: A Less Sexy Harley Quinn Costume
2.plot: Harley Quinn is one of the coolest supervillains I know! She's crazy, she's ruthless, and she's a hopeless romantic. (At least she is in my favorite Batman franchise, Batman the Animated Series). Now I'm not saying that female superhero/villain costumes have ever been realistic, but lately Harley's costume has gotten sexier and sexier and is about to fall off. So I decided to bring it back to the realm of possibility with my Halloween costume this year. I give you: Harley Quinn in the world of The Dark Knight. Not exactly a conservative outfit in real world standards,...

4.title: Ballpoint Universe
4.plot: A review of Ballpoint Universe Infinite, a little indie game on Steam. All the images in the game are ballpoint pen drawings! Quirky and a bit gimmicky, but I must admit I've never seen anything like it before.

5.title: Facebook and Oculus Rift
5.plot: A video about what Facebook is going to do with the Oculus Rift technology.

6.title: Game Review: Obamacare
6.plot: A review of Obamacare (Covered California) as if it was a video game.

7.title: Things I Like
7.plot: A video detailing the things that the hosts likes. It includes dogs, panda art, coconuts, the color orange, video games, The Simpsons, and burnt toast.

imdb.title: Geeks Outside
plot: A web series with sketch comedy shorts and vlogs about video games, sci-fi, online dating, and other nerd things. "Going Outside" is really a metaphor for socially awkward people trying to interact with others.
